content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 8 is:

7->8 The path is represented as a sequence of nodes, with each node separated by a space.

Note that the path is the same as the original shortest path minus the last point (node 8). This is because you requested that if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 8 is:

7 The path is represented as a sequence of nodes, with each node separated by a space.

Note that the destination point you provided was incorrect. Please provide the correct destination point and I will return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point.
